beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Heck of the North. Two Harbors, Minnesota. 100 mi. Constant rolling terrain with no extended flats. 4.5 thousand ft over 100 miles = lots of short, punchy climbs. No sustained mountain-style climbs, but relentless ups and downs. 60% snowmobile trails make this a technical skills test as much as a fitness test. Think XC mountain biking on a gravel bike.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Technicality. 5 out of 5. The course is the competitor. Community. 5 out of 5. Strangers become friends by mile ten. Post-race hot soup and sandwiches at the Two Harbors community center is small-town Minnesota hospitality at its finest. Logistics. 4 out of 5. Well-oiled machine. Aid stations where you need them. Free parking at Two Harbors City Hall and 17 years of race experience show in the execution. Length. 4 out of 5. This is a long day. Plan accordingly. Mike Ward hit 50 miles in 2:45 through paceline work, noting "15 minutes per 5 mile watch split" before the technical terrain slowed progress. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Remote terrain. Self-sufficiency required. Water crossings at Lester River, technical snowmobile trails through dense Northwoods, and unpredictable late September weather create uncertainty. Experience. 4 out of 5. Special. This race sticks with you. Fall colors at peak, Lake Superior views, and gnarly snowmobile trails through dense Minnesota woods create adventure. Value. 4 out of 5. One of the better deals in gravel. Aid stations provide substantial support with "water, energy drink, cola, bananas, pb & j sandwiches, chips, and gummy bears" plus toilets at each stop. Expenses. 4 out of 5. Your wallet will survive this one.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: The Snowmobile-Trail MTB Skills Test. If you've got mountain bike skills and don't mind wrestling roots and rocks for 100 miles, this is your jam. The snowmobile trails demand 40mm+ tires and actual bike handling. your road racing background won't save you here. Skip it if you're looking for fast gravel or hate technical terrain that slows you to 8 mph.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Heck of the North isn't quite right for you. Gravel Worlds gives you similar distance with less technical bullshit, while Lutsen 99er keeps you in Minnesota but trades the tech for pure climbing suffering. Both let you actually use your fitness instead of just surviving the trail.
